result.execSummary:
The defendant Bridgette Yvette Parker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Total length of imprisonment of 5 years; 30 months initial imprisonment; 30 months of extended supervision. Credit for 51 days time served.  Sentence imposed and STAYED, defendant placed on probation.
Concurrent with: concurrent with to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: IF REVOKED defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE FOR CIP; but IS ELIGIBLE for WSAP.

miscConds.notes: Restitution ordered $795.00 to Douglas/Jeanne M; $2764 to KENT/lAURA W., 875 to Waterstone Bank
She may never again possess firearms or weapons.

erve condition time of 8 months in the HOC, Huber privileges for work and treatment.  AFTER the first 90 days, Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*No contact with victims.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within term of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
  IF REVOKED, to be collected by the DOC out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
 
- IF REVOKED, Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/2 initial confinement.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges for work and treatment. AFTER the first 90 days, Court recommends release to Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bridgette Yvette Parker in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Additional statements by:  Kent W.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $795.00 owed to Douglas/Jeanne M., $254.00 owed to Kent/Laura W., and $875.00 owed to Waterstone Bank, payable as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  IF REVOKED, to be collected by the DOC out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  RESTITUTION TO BE PAID BEFORE COSTS AND SURCHARGES.  Any bail to be applied.
 
COUNT 1:  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 5 years, concurrent with any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 30 months with credit for 51 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 30 months.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3
years with the following conditions:
*Serve condition time of 8 months in the HOC, Huber privileges for work and treatment.  AFTER the first 90 days, Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*No contact with victims.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within term of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  IF REVOKED, to be collected by the DOC out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
 
- IF REVOKED, Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/2 initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 5 years, concurrent with any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 30 months with credit for 51 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 30 months.

JusticePoint Discharge Summary addressed; defendant is not in compliance with conditions of bail.  State does not request modification of bail; however, court admonished defendant again regarding compliance.  JusticePoint monitoring to resume immediately.

Defendant Bridgette Yvette Parker in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood (for attorney Louis Epps).  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Epps does not appear and does not contact the court.  Victims present in court.  State's request to have Attorney Epps removed from the case partially granted by the court.  If attorney Lockwood is unable to secure attorney Epps' appearance at next court date, he will handle the sentencing himself.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint discharge summary received and filed.

Defendant Bridgette Yvette Parker in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Defendant Bridgette Yvette Parker in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp   LAST ADJOURNMENT.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 11-14-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bridgette Yvette Parker in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for James C. Griffin for the State of Wisconsin. State requesting an adjournment the victim in Count 1 is unable to appear today. No objection from Defense. Court grant request. Court ordered Defendant to report to JusticePoint right after this hearing to discuss working on a treatment plan. Court ordered that all conditions of bail to continue. Court ordered Defendant to cooperate with JusticePoint.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JUSTICE POINT Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Bridgette Yvette Parker in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker ABBEHI MEDRANO.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for SENTENCING on SEPTEMBER 19, 2014 in Branch 26.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Bridgette Yvette Parker in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court Orders PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge POCAN, Branch 26, in ROOM 634 of the COURTHOUSE.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-19-2014 at 08:30 am.

Scheduling conference held off the record.  Defense counsel requests a projected guilty plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 34.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bridgette Yvette Parker in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Bridgette Yvette Parker in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Original Information filed.  Defendants motion for bail heard and denied.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  kmw

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Bridgette Yvette Parker in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Bridgette Yvette Parker in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Arraignment scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
